org.wiredwidgets.cow.server.web

Class ProcessesController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wiredwidgets.cow.server.web.CowServerController
      • org.wiredwidgets.cow.server.web.ProcessesController

  • @Controller
@RequestMapping(value="/processes")
public class ProcessesController
extends CowServerController
    Controller for REST operations for the /processes resource
    Author:
    JKRANES

      • getBpmn20Process

        @RequestMapping(value="/{workflowName}",
                params="format=bpmn20")
@ResponseBody
public Definitions getBpmn20Process(@PathVariable(value="workflowName")
                                                       String wflowName)
        Retrieves a workflow process in BPMN 2.0 format. This method only works for workflow processes that were originally created in COW format.
        Parameters:
        wflowName - the process key
        Returns:
        the process in BPMN2.0 format

      • getCowProcess

        @RequestMapping(value="/{workflowName}",
                params="format=cow",
                produces="application/xml")
@ResponseBody
public Process getCowProcess(@PathVariable(value="workflowName")
                                                String wflowName)
        Retrieves a workflow process in COW format. This method only works for workflow processes that were originally created in COW format.
        Parameters:
        wflowName - the process key. Note: any "/" characters must be doubly encoded to "%252F"
        Returns:
        the XML process document

      • getV2Process

                produces="application/xml")
@ResponseBody
public Process getV2Process(@PathVariable(value="workflowName")
                                               String workFlowName)
        For backward compatibility. 'cow' is preferred over 'v2'. Calls getCowProcess
        Parameters:
        workFlowName -
        Returns:
        See Also:

      • createProcess

        @RequestMapping(method=POST)
@ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Process> createProcess(@RequestBody
                                                                                         Process process,
                                                                                         org.springframework.web.util.UriComponentsBuilder uriBuilder)
        Create a new process. Attempts to use process.getKey() as the id. If the id is taken the process's key will be set to a unique value. The response body will contain the process with its key updated. The uri that can be used to get the newly created process can be found in the response's "Location" header.
        Parameters:
        process -
        uriBuilder -
        Returns:

      • updateProcess

        @RequestMapping(value="/{workflowName}",
                method=PUT)
@ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateProcess(@PathVariable(value="workflowName")
                                                                                   String wflowName,
                                                                                   @RequestBody
                                                                                   Process process,
                                                                                   org.springframework.web.util.UriComponentsBuilder uriBuilder)
        Attempts to update the specified process. If the process updates normally the response will have status code 200. If the process doesn't already exist it will be created and the response will have status code 201. A process cannot be modified when there are instances of it running. If there are instances of the process running the response will have status code 409, and the body will contain the running instances of the process.
        Parameters:
        wflowName -
        process -
        uriBuilder -
        Returns:

      • deleteProcess

        @RequestMapping(value="/{workflowName}",
                method=DELETE)
@ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteProcess(@PathVariable(value="workflowName")
                                                                                   String wflowName)
        A process cannot be modified when there are instances of it running. If there are instances of the process running the response will have status code 409, and the body will contain the running instances of the process.
        Parameters:
        wflowName -
        Returns:
        204 if successful, 404 if not found, 409 if running instances
